http://penrodcrm.com/careers/web-developer

Web Developer Job

This is an exciting opportunity to help drive continued growth for an innovative, rapidly growing enterprise software company!

The Role
Penrod Software, located in Milwaukee's Historic Third Ward, is seeking a Web Developer to join their rapidly growing team. Are you ambitious, self-motivated, and a quick learner? Read on!

At Penrod Software, we use our world-class programming skills to innovate in enterprise applications such as Salesforce.com, Google Apps, and Microsoft Dynamics. Our projects include working with advanced business processes and business intelligence systems, providing solutions to ensure user adoption, and custom applications that enrich the user experience. Our Web Developer will consult, organize, and manage web-based projects and develop, theme, and deploy top-notch solutions.

Responsibilities

Contribute throughout the end-to-end delivery lifecycle of complex and large-scale technology solutions
Use modern methods of development (frameworks, web services, cloud deployment, etc)
Plan and estimate web technology work
Collaborate with team members on new projects and ideas
Drive forward delivery of high quality work on-time and on-budget
Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
3+ years web development experience
Knowledge of standard web languages, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery
Experience with common libraries (YUI, jQuery, etc) and debugging tools (Firebug, etc.)
Knowledge of (and a passion for) current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, accessibility and usability
Work closely with engineering and product teams to define our next generation business applications
Why Penrod?
Penrod Software is startup that’s dedicated to changing the way people work with business applications. We're building a platform for productivity, so a great user experience is always our top priority. We're assertive, bright, highly motivated, and eager people who love what we do.

We enjoy the vibe, spirit, and flexibility of a startup. We're flexible, fast, and open to everyone's ideas. We know that having fun, being challenged, and constantly pushing builds great products.

Job Perks
Penrod Software offers its employees a creative and fast-paced working environment. Penrod Software differentiates itself from others by hiring people who can grow with our company. We hire some of the brightest minds in the Midwest and invest in their personal growth, while avoiding politics. We employ a flat corporate hierarchy: everyone is equal and able to do the job they want to do.

Flexible work arrangement, which allows employees to work when and where they want (including work-from-home at your discretion and the ability to flex your schedule around your personal commitments)
Employee healthcare plan
Casual dress at the office. Shorts and sandals are encouraged
Respect for your work/life balance
Unlimited PTO and 10 day company holidays each year
Employees get an extra day of PTO for their birthdays
Company outings, lunches, and happy hours
An open-concept office environment (no Dilbert-like cube farms)
Personal workspaces include multiple LCD monitors and a Herman Miller Aeron chair
In-office recreation includes ping pong and video games
Kitchen stocked with snacks and beverages, including Keurig coffeemaker
100% coverage of expenses related to Microsoft certification testing, preparation, and exam fees
Free parking or transit to our unique office in the Historic Third Ward
Join a great team; there's absolutely no 'dead weight' here.

To Apply
Submit PDF resume to careers@penrodsoftware.com.


https://penrod.workable.com/jobs/82465
Software Developer Intern
Milwaukee, Wisconsin, United States · Development
DESCRIPTION

The Role

This is an exciting opportunity to help drive continued growth for an innovative, rapidly growing enterprise software company!

The Role

Penrod Software, located in Milwaukee's Historic Third Ward, is seeking a Software Developer Intern to join their growing team. We use our world-class programming skills to innovate in enterprise applications such as Salesforce.com and Google Apps. Our projects include working with advanced business processes and business intelligence systems, providing solutions to ensure user adoption, and custom applications that enrich the user experience. 

If coding is your passion both in and out of the classroom or if you are an excellent designer looking to gain more programming experience, we will help you learn and grow. Ambition and work ethic are the main prerequisites for this internship.   
REQUIREMENTS

Responsibilities:

Participate in the full product development life cycle of different applications that solve many problems businesses face today
Researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production lifecycle
Coding, maintaining and testing software
Qualifications:

Want to code in a variety of languages
Work closely with engineering and product teams to help with our next generation business applications
Ability to execute creatively and independently
Outstanding communication skills
BENEFITS

Penrod Software offers its employees a creative and fast-paced working environment. Penrod Software differentiates itself from others by hiring people who can grow with our company. We hire some of the brightest minds in the Midwest and invest in their personal growth, while avoiding politics. We employ a flat corporate hierarchy: everyone is equal and able to do the job they want to do.

Flexible work arrangement, which allows employees to work when and where they want (including work-from-home at your discretion and the ability to flex your schedule around your personal commitments).
Casual dress at the office. Shorts and sandals are encouraged.
Respect for your work/life balance.
Company outings, lunches, and happy hours.
An open-concept office environment (no Dilbert-like cube farms).
Personal workspaces include multiple LCD monitors and a Herman Miller Aeron chair.
In-office recreation includes Ping Pong and video games.
Kitchen stocked with snacks and beverages, including Keurig coffeemaker.
100% coverage of expenses related to certification, testing, preparation, and exam fees.
Free parking or transit to our unique office in the Historic Third Ward. 
Join a great team; there's absolutely no 'dead weight' here.

Please Note:

Absolutely do not call to check on the status of your resume, you will be disqualified from consideration.

To all recruitment agencies:

Penrod Software does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Penrod Software employees, or any other company location. Penrod Software is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Summary
Addy is a Staff Engineer at Google working with the Chrome team on Polymer, with a focus on developer tooling & Web Component polyfills. He is also the engineering lead for several open-source projects including Yeoman, Google Web Starter Kit, TodoMVC and upcoming Material Design libraries. Addy is the author of books including Learning JavaScript Design Patterns and Backbone Fundamentals.

OPEN POSITIONS
GET NOTIFIED WHEN WE POST NEW JOB DESCRIPTIONS

SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER

SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER

Catchafire is looking for a passionate, quality-focused senior software engineer with a social conscience. Your job will be to support, enhance, and expand Catchafire's pro bono matching website. If you have passion not only for technology but also for applying technology to further social causes in new and innovative ways, we'd like to speak with you.

THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THIS POSITION INCLUDE:
Engaging in all aspects of software development, including architecture, documentation, unit testing, and deployment using Python and the Django framework
Writing Django templates, JavaScript, and basic HTML and CSS
Working with internal sales, community, operations, product team and executive staff to review and implement ideas
Website systems administration and optimization on Ubuntu servers
Providing leadership to and mentoring other technology team members
KEY QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years experience coding in Python
5+ years experience using the Django (or similar) web framework
Experience with consumer-facing web applications
5+ years SQL experience
3+ years experience coding JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Experience scaling and administering full web application stacks
Eagerness to learn and work at all levels of responsibility
Working knowledge of source code control and unit testing
VALUABLE EXPERIENCE
Experience scaling with MySQL
Experience working in the social good sector
Project leadership and management duties
Experience using Fabric for devops tasks
Experience with nginx, gunicorn, caching systems
If you're truly awesome, and have some characteristic that you believe will compensate for lacking one of the key skills, just explain it in your submission.
COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
Competitive salary commensurate with experience
Comprehensive benefits
If our values resonate with you, email your resume to careers@catchafire.org. Include "Senior Software Engineer" in the subject. Telecommuting is an option for folks willing to align their workday, for at least a few hours, with US East coast business hours. No recruiters, please. P.S., we are still accepting applications, and will be until this line is removed!

Experience
Senior Web Developer
Mozilla
March 2014 – Present (1 year 5 months)
Primarily development of the Mozilla Developer Network's (MDN) new revamp. Front-end work with jQuery, CSS, and HTML5, back end work with Python / Django, NodeJS.

Occasionally helping out with the Mozilla Marketplace and other Mozilla initiatives.

All-around web dominance.
Web Developer
Mozilla Corporation
April 2012 – Present (3 years 4 months)Madison, WI
Primarily development of the Mozilla Developer Network's (MDN) new revamp. Front-end work with jQuery, CSS, and HTML5, back end work with Python / Django, NodeJS.

Occasionally helping out with the Mozilla Marketplace and other Mozilla initiatives.

All-around web dominance.
Core Developer
MooTools Production Team
March 2009 – Present (6 years 5 months)
My main responsibility with the MooTools JavaScript development team is community interaction and education about the framework. I've written hundreds of blog posts about accomplishing simple and difficult tasks with MooTools, relating other frameworks to MooTools, and educating thousands of developers along the way. I've spoken at conferences about the framework, and have become the primary voice of the team.
Founder
Wynq Web Labs
November 2008 – Present (6 years 9 months)Madison, WI
Wynq Web Labs is my freelance web development front. I've completed work for large businesses like Best Buy and agencies such as Avenue Verve.

I maintain the David Walsh Blog (http://davidwalsh.name) under the Wynq brand as well.
Software Engineer
SitePen, Inc.
April 2010 – April 2012 (2 years 1 month)
Responsibilities include coding enterprise-level JavaScript-powered web applications with the Dojo Toolkit, submitting patches to the Dojo Toolkit, training material creation and classroom delivery, client support, tutorial and blog post creation, and direct client communication. Technical Lead on multiple projects.
Senior Web Developer
Econoprint, Inc.
July 2005 – April 2010 (4 years 10 months)
Responsible for advanced PHP/MySQL, JavaScript (MooTools and jQuery), CSS, and XML programming as well as domain, hosting, and email campaign management.
